snippet: The Catholic Campaign for Human Development is under pressure from conservative Catholics to ensure that it is not helping organizations that run afoul of church positions.
abstract: Catholic Campaign for Human Development, which doles out $8 million annually to about 250 groups nationwide, is under increasing pressure from conservative Catholic groups to ensure that it is not unwittingly aiding organizations that run afoul of church positions on issues like birth control and same-sex marriage; since 2010, nine groups from across the country have lost financing from the campaign because of conflicts with Catholic principles; others have simply chosen not to apply, or reapply, for funds.
lead_paragraph: The Catholic Campaign for Human Development is under pressure from conservative Catholics to ensure that it is not helping organizations that run afoul of church positions.

headline.seo: Catholic Fund Heightens Scrutiny of Recipients’ Ties
headline.main: Catholic Fund Cuts Off Aid Over Groups’ Affiliations
headline.print_headline: Catholic Fund Cuts Off Groups Over Ties Unsettling to Church

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
